answerText: Lyrical Ballads[10] Lyrical Ballads contains poems by both Samuel Taylor Coleridge and this author of the volume's preface and "Tintern Abbey." He also wrote about wandering "lonely as a cloud" in a poem sometimes called "Daffodils."
heading: MAGNI |2011 | 1 | 2 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The preface to this work suggests that good poetry is the "spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings" and advocates the use of "the very language of men" rather than artificial poetic diction. For 10 points each: [10] Name this poetic collection that contains a poem in which a little girl insists on counting her dead brother and sister as among her siblings, "We Are Seven," as well as "Tintern Abbey."
